search_results.snippet:
The Bride of Lammermoor is a historical novel by Sir Walter Scott, published in 
1819. The novel is set in the Lammermuir Hills of south-east Scotland, and tells of 
a tragic love affair between young Lucy Ashton and her family's enemy Edgar 
Ravenswood. Scott indicated the plot was based on an actual incident. ... The 
story is the basis for Donizetti's 1835 opera Lucia di Lammermoor.
